oneOf.description: Supplied is a link to a Markdown/HTML file.

url.description: A url pointing to a valid Markdown/HTML file.
url.title: url

oneOf.title: MarkdownContentLinkSpec

additionalProperties.description: One of the supported task specs

userTasks.description: Allow the user to create tasks from the given map of id => task_spec
userTasks.title: userTasks

name.description: HIT name (for display)
name.title: name

repeat.description: number of copies or instances of the HIT
repeat.title: repeat

tasks.description: list of tasks in the HIT

items.description: One of the supported task specs

autoSubmit.description: Tasks will be submitted automatically when the media or timer ends.
autoSubmit.title: autoSubmit

controls.description: sets the input button controls for the task
controls.title: controls

intensityInput.description: sets the type of intensity input
intensityInput.title: intensityInput

controls.description: Button controls
controls.title: controls

jump_speed.description: Initial speed when a key is pressed
jump_speed.title: jump_speed

maxSubmissions.description: Maximum number of submissions a user can make for the task.
maxSubmissions.title: maxSubmissions

canMute.description: User is able to mute the video
canMute.title: canMute

fps.description:
Frames per second of the video file.
Some tasks use it to collect data once per frame.
fps.title: fps

muted.description: Video should be played without audio
muted.title: muted

speed.description:
Speed of the video in multiples of real time (1x)
0 will allow the user to change speed (starting at 1x)
speed.title: speed

canMute.description: User is able to mute the video
canMute.title: canMute

fps.description:
Frames per second of the video file.
Some tasks use it to collect data once per frame.

muted.title: muted

speed.description:
Speed of the video in multiples of real time (1x)
0 will allow the user to change speed (starting at 1x)
speed.title: speed

name.description: Name of the task. It is displayed in covfee (eg. "Video 3")
name.title: name

prerequisite.description:
Task is marked as a prerrequisite
Prerrequisite tasks must be completed before the rests of the tasks in the HIT are revealed.
prerequisite.title: prerequisite

maxTime.description: Max time (in seconds) the user may take to complete the task
maxTime.title: maxTime

useRequestAnimationFrame.description:
Uses requestAnimationFrame as trigger for data reads.
requestAnimationFrame normally fires at close to 60Hz
Setting to true can improve the quality for lower framerate media by capturing data points between frames.
If enabled, data annotations may not align with media frame times.
useRequestAnimationFrame.title: useRequestAnimationFrame

autoSubmit.description: Tasks will be submitted automatically when the media or timer ends.
autoSubmit.title: autoSubmit

controls.description: sets the input button controls for the task

toggle-occluded.description: toggle the occlusion flag (for occluded objects/parts)
toggle-occluded.title: toggle-occluded

controls.title: controls

oneOf.description: Props for the antd input field
oneOf.title: InputFieldSpec

dots.description: Whether the thumb can drag over tick only
dots.title: dots

max.description: The maximum value the slider can slide to
max.title: max

min.description: The minimum value the slider can slide to
min.title: min

step.description: The granularity the slider can step through values. Must greater than 0, and be divided by (max - min) . When marks no null, step can be null
step.title: step

vertical.description: If true, the slider will be vertical
vertical.title: vertical

label.description:
Label for the field.
Usually displayed next to or on top of the field.
label.title: label

name.description:
Name of the field.
The results will refer to the field by this name.
name.title: name

required.description: If true the field will be required to be filled before submission.
required.title: required

tooltip.description: Text for a tooltip with more information
tooltip.title: tooltip

fps.description: Video fps. Required to obtain frame number from time (since frame number is not directly accesible in browsers).
fps.title: fps

res.description: Video resolution. This is the resolution of the original video. The final stacked video has double the horizontal resolution.
res.title: res

speed.description:
Speed of the video in multiples of real time (1x)
0 will allow the user to change speed (starting at 1x)
speed.title: speed

email.description: email of the contact person for the project.
email.title: email

hits.description: List of HIT specifications, one for each Human Intelligence Task in this project.

useRequestAnimationFrame.description:
Uses requestAnimationFrame as trigger for data reads.
requestAnimationFrame normally fires at close to 60Hz
Setting to true can improve the quality for lower framerate media by capturing data points between frames.
If enabled, data annotations may not align with media frame times.
